vocHash.h

00001 /* vocHash.h - Simple C Hashtable Class
00002  */
00003 
00004 /* Only copies of keys and values are stored in the table, not the
00005  * orignals.
00006  *
00007  * The hashtable does not grow automatically, but only when the hashtable
00008  * grow function is called. Growing the hashtable is a safe operation:
00009  * if growing the hashtable fails, the existing hashtable is not
00010  * destroyed or modified.
00011  *
00012  * This hashtable is not thread-safe.
00013  */
00014 
00015 #ifndef VOCHASH_H
00016 #define VOCHASH_H
00017 
00018 #include <stdlib.h>
00019 #include <string.h>
00020 
00021 /* Hash table node; one per key-value pair. */
00022 typedef struct vocHash_node_t {
00023     void *key;          /* key for the node */
00024     size_t keylen;      /* length of the key */
00025     void *value;        /* value for this node */
00026     size_t vallen;      /* length of the value */
00027     struct vocHash_node_t *next;    /* next node (open hashtable) */
00028 } vocHash_node_t;
00029 
00030 /* Main descriptor for hash table. */
00031 typedef struct vocHash_t {
00032     vocHash_node_t **arr;
00033     size_t size;        /* size of the hash */
00034     int count;          /* number if items in this table */
00035     int (*hash_func) (void *, size_t, size_t);  /* hash function */
00036     int nocase;         /* use case-insensitive compares */
00037 } vocHash_t;
00038 
00039 /* Iterator type for iterating through the hashtable. */
00040 typedef struct vocHash_iter_t {
00041     /* key and value of current item */
00042     void *key;
00043     void *value;
00044     size_t keylen;
00045     size_t vallen;
00046 
00047     /* bookkeeping data */
00048     struct vocHash_internal_t {
00049     vocHash_t *hashtable;
00050     vocHash_node_t *node;
00051     int index;
00052     } internal;
00053 
00054 } vocHash_iter_t;
00055 
00056 /* Initialize a new hashtable (set bookingkeeping data) and return a
00057  * pointer to the hashtable. A hash function may be provided. If no
00058  * function pointer is given (a NULL pointer), then the built in hash
00059  * function is used. A NULL pointer returned if the creation of the
00060  * hashtable failed due to a failed malloc().
00061  */
00062 vocHash_t *vht_init(size_t size,
00063     int (*hash_func) (void *key, size_t keylen, size_t ht_size), char *flag);
00064 
00065 /* Fetch a value from table matching the key. Returns a pointer to
00066  * the value matching the given key.  The searchKey variant takes
00067  * a string-valued key.
00068  */
00069 void *vht_search(vocHash_t *hashtable, void *key, size_t keylen);
00070 void *vht_searchKey(vocHash_t *hashtable, char *key);
00071 
00072 /* Put a value into the table with the given key. Returns NULL if
00073  * malloc() fails to allocate memory for the new node.  The insertKey
00074  * variant takes a string-valued key.
00075  */
00076 void *vht_insert(vocHash_t *hashtable,
00077     void *key, size_t keylen, void *value, size_t vallen);
00078 void *vht_insertKey(vocHash_t *hashtable, char *key, void *value);
00079 
00080 /* Delete the given key and value pair from the hashtable. If the key
00081  * does not exist, no error is given.  The removeKey variant takes a
00082  * string-valued key.
00083  */
00084 void vht_remove(vocHash_t *hashtable, void *key, size_t keylen);
00085 void vht_removeKey(vocHash_t *hashtable, char *key);
00086 
00087 /* Change the size of the hashtable. It will allocate a new hashtable
00088  * and move all keys and values over. The pointer to the new hashtable
00089  * is returned. Will return NULL if the new hashtable fails to be
00090  * allocated. If this happens, the old hashtable will not be altered
00091  * in any way. The old hashtable is destroyed upon a successful grow.
00092  */
00093 void *vht_grow(vocHash_t * hashtable, size_t new_size);
00094 
00095 /* Free all resources used by the hashtable. */
00096 void vht_destroy(vocHash_t * hashtable);
00097 
00098 /* Initialize the given iterator. It will point to the first element
00099  * in the hashtable.
00100  */
00101 void vht_iter_init(vocHash_t * hashtable, vocHash_iter_t * ii);
00102 
00103 /* Increment the iterator to the next element. The iterator key and
00104  * value will point to NULL values when the iterator has reached the
00105  * end of the hashtable.
00106  */
00107 void vht_iter_inc(vocHash_iter_t * ii);
00108 
00109 /* Default hashtable hash function. */
00110 int vht_hash(void *key, size_t key_size, size_t hashtab_size);
00111 
00112 #endif
